attributes.action: No BREXIT transitional period, the UK should leave March 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
People voted to leave the single market, close our borders and take control of our courts.
There should be no transitional period beyond March 2019. Any transitional period, that keeps the United Kingdom in the single market or under the direction of the European Courts Of Justice or gives the European Union control over our borders, is an attempt to frustrate the will of the people and keep the United Kingdom within the European Union. 
The EU has also shown it is in no mood to negotiate.
attributes.background: It is the duty of our Government to honour the referendum and the will of its people and take back control of our borders our Courts and leave the single market in March 2019 in line with Article 50 with no transition period beyond March 2019.
